Armistice between Turkey & the Allies

The signing of the Armistice between Turkey & the Allies on 30th October 1918 at Mudros. Ahmet Izzet Pasha (1864 - 1937). Izzet negotiated the Turkish Armistice at the end of World War One

Mary Evans Picture Library makes available wonderful images created for people to enjoy over the centuries

EDITORS COMMENTS

This powerful print captures a pivotal moment in history - the signing of the Armistice between Turkey and the Allies on October 30th, 1918 at Mudros. In the center of the image stands Ahmet Izzet Pasha, a key figure who negotiated this important agreement that marked the end of World War One. Dressed in his military uniform, Izzet exudes authority and determination as he represents Turkey during this historic event. Surrounding him are soldiers and officers from both sides, symbolizing the unity and cooperation necessary to bring about peace after years of conflict. The significance of this armistice cannot be overstated, as it not only brought an end to one of the deadliest wars in history but also set the stage for future diplomatic relations between Turkey and its former enemies. Izzet's skillful negotiations played a crucial role in securing favorable terms for his country while also honoring its commitments to its allies. As we reflect on this momentous occasion captured in black-and-white detail, we are reminded of the sacrifices made by all those involved in World War One and inspired by their efforts to find common ground amidst adversity. This print serves as a poignant reminder of our shared history and collective responsibility to strive for lasting peace.
